title: Sri Lanka to send state workers for foreign jobs: Minister
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka will encourage state workers to go abroad and new rules will be issued shortly to support the effort, Foreign Minister Manusha Nanayakkara said.
“The health ministry is working on rules to help nurses go abroad,” Minister Nanayakkara said.
“There are some issue such as seniority that has to be looked into.”
The Public Administration Ministry will separately issue a circular, he said.
Sri Lanka is trying to get more people abroad to bring in foreign exchange and generally provide livelihoods as higher levels of unemployment looms after a currency collpase.
